title: Trump says he'll halt funds to schools that 'indoctrinate' students
shortDescription: President Donald Trump issued an order Wednesday saying he would divert federal funds from schools teaching "discriminatory equity ideology."

title: Trump appeals NY hush money guilty verdict. What will he argue?
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump formally appealed his New York felony conviction, jumpstarting his latest fight to get the guilty verdict thrown out.

title: White House rescinds memo freezing federal funding
shortDescription: The Trump administration has rescinded a memo to freeze federal funding across all agencies, which critics call unconstitutional.

title: Trump signs executive order bolstering school choice
shortDescription: President Donald Trump on Wednesday signed an executive order directing federal agencies to find ways to favor school choice programs.

title: Trump sued over alleged effort to hire 'unqualified political flunkies'
shortDescription: The largest union for government employees sued the Trump administration to block an executive order that strips federal workers of job protections.

title: Senate confirms Lee Zeldin as EPA administrator
shortDescription: Zeldin, 44, is from New York. He served eight years in Congress and lost a race for governor in 2022. He is expected to push deregulation.

title: Proposal to change 22nd Amendment doesn't apply to Obama | Fact check
shortDescription: The proposed constitutional amendment excludes presidents who served two consecutive terms, such as former President Barack Obama, from a third term.

title: President Trump plans to house detained migrants at Guantanamo Bay
shortDescription: President Trump said his administration will create a 30,000-person migrant facility at Guantanamo Bay for "the worst criminal illegal aliens."

title: Child support recipients can still get tax credits | Fact check
shortDescription: Trump made several policy pronouncements after winning election, but he did not call for ending child tax credits for child support recipients.

title: President Trump signs Laken Riley Act, escalating migrant crackdown
shortDescription: Donald Trump signed the Laken Riley Act into law, empowering immigration officers to detain unauthorized immigrants when they're arrested for crimes.

title: Trump administration rescinds freeze memo on federal grants
shortDescription: The Trump administration reversed its policy to freeze grants and loans while officials evaluated whether spending met the president's priorities.

title: USDA inspector general escorted from office after defying Trump
shortDescription: Phyllis Fong, a 22-year veteran of the Agriculture Department, had told colleagues that she intended to stay after the White House fired her Friday.

title: RFK Jr. takes dig at Trump's diet amid testimony about processed foods
shortDescription: In confirmation hearing, RFK Jr. says he doesn't want to take hamburgers away.

title: AOC didn't file impeachment articles over Jan. 6 pardons | Fact check
shortDescription: House members Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Jamie Raskin have not filed articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump over his Jan. 6 pardons.

title: DOJ drops classified-documents case against Trump co-defendants
shortDescription: U.S. Attorney Hayden O'Byrne asked the appeals court to dismiss the classified documents case in a way it could not be appealed again.

title: Transgender troops react to Trump order
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has issued an executive order restricting transgender people in the military.

title: Trump administration ends immigration protection for Venezuelans
shortDescription: DHS Secretary Kristi Noem told Fox News that Venezuelans would be evaluated like other immigrants.

title: Pam Bondi approved by Senate committee for attorney general bid
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump's nominee to lead the Justice Department, Pam Bondi, was approved in a party-line vote by the Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: President Trump offers federal workers a buyout
shortDescription: President Donald Trump offered eight months of full pay and benefits for federal workers. Critics say he doesn't have the authority to make the offer.
